arts.sum: If Barcelona were just looking to get back to winning ways after the international break, they outdid themselves against Valencia last night in their first game after the hiatus. arts.ttl: Barcelona routs Valencia 6-0 with goals from Raphinha, Lewandowski and López
arts.sum: Raphinha, Robert Lewandowski and Fermín López scored two goals each as Barcelona routed Valencia 6-0 in the Spanish league on Sunday. Lewandowski, playing his 150th game with Barcelona, had not previously scored for the club in this league season.

arts.ttl: No Yamal, No Problem: Takeaways From Barcelona’s 6–0 Win vs. Valencia
arts.sum: Barcelona played their best game of the season and were merciless against Valencia.

arts.ttl: Brilliant Barcelona dismantle vulnerable Valencia in happy homecoming
arts.sum: Brilliant Barcelona enjoy a happy homecoming on Sunday night, dismantling Valencia 6-0 in their first home fixture of the 2025-26 La Liga season.

arts.ttl: Fermin Lopez 9.0, Lewandowski 8.5 | Barcelona 6-0 Valencia: Player ratings
arts.sum: A brilliant performance from start to finish sees Barcelona completely dismantle Valencia. The Catalan giants, in their first home game of the season, showcase their true attacking prowess. Even without Lamine Yamal, Hansi Flick’s side was too much for Valencia to handle. arts.ttl: Barcelona Player Ratings vs. Valencia: Fermin, Raphinha, Lewandowski Share Goals in 6–0 Rout
arts.sum: The Catalans scored five goals in the second half in a dominant performance.

arts.ttl: Barcelona smash six past Valencia on La Liga return
arts.sum: Barcelona battered Valencia on their return to La Liga action with a 6-0 home win back on home soil in Catalonia. La Blaugrana were forced to play at the Estadi Johan Cruyff after the latest delay to their return to the Camp Nou but there was no issue for Hansi Flick’s team.
